metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7449 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ssl_do_connect function in common/server.c in HexChat before 2.10.2,XChat, and XChat-GNOME does not verify that the server hostname matches adomain name in the X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middleattackers to spoof SSL servers via an arbitrary valid certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7449` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hexchat - 2.10.2-1ubuntu2
hexchat-common - 2.10.2-1ubuntu2
hexchat-perl - 2.10.2-1ubuntu2
hexchat-plugins - 2.10.2-1ubuntu2
hexchat-python - 2.10.2-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

xchat-gnome - 1:0.30.0~git20141005.816798-0ubuntu9
xchat-gnome-common - 1:0.30.0~git20141005.816798-0ubuntu9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: hexchat package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.2-1ubuntu2').
xchat-gnome package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:0.30.0~git20141005.816798-0ubuntu9').
